intro: Microlicia woodgyeriana, commonly known as the Cape York microlicia, is a small shrub native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and riverine areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
